content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_tta_accordion shape=”square” active_section=”666″ collapsible_all=”true” title=”UK / Europe”][vc_tta_section title=”Loss Adjuster – Renewable Energy (Europe and Africa)” tab_id=”loss-adjuster-renewable-energy-europe-africa”][vc_column_text]AqualisBraemar is looking for an Engineer/Energy Loss Adjuster to join the London team with a focus on renewable energy assignments.

An electrical or mechanical engineer with offshore wind project management or project engineering experience is preferred, but the role is diverse and not limited to these specific disciplines.  The position would be to work out of the London office, and operate throughout Europe, and other regions as required, providing technical review and adjusting a variety of wind and solar losses.  The ideal candidate must be able to speak and write fluent English, happy to present to a diverse but technically proficient audience and can demonstrate a proven track record of working within the renewable energy field.  The candidate will have a client facing role with renewable energy companies, as well as the London and International insurance market and whilst regional language skills are appreciated, they are not a requisite.

The Role

Investigating, managing and negotiating Renewable Energy related insurance claims; with an emphasis on construction, operational, and time element losses.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Onsite survey of damage / losses, as well as meeting with relevant technical personnel
  • Investigate Cause
  • Review of technical documentation (procedures, logs, Root Cause Analysis, etc.)
  • Contract & Policy Interpretation
  • Quantification and valuation of remedial measures
  • Preparation of Reports
  • Travel is required to survey damages as well as meet with technical representatives and clients
  • Marketing role involving both renewable energy companies and local/international Insurance companies
  • Continuing Education where appropriate (including insurance qualifications as required)

Qualities, Skills & Attributes Required

  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • University graduate
  • Professional engineering qualification would be preferred, including 3-5 years in the renewable energy industry in their engineering discipline
  • If not already held, able to reflect strong progress against recognised insurance professional qualifications

Salary & Remuneration

Dependent upon the individual candidates experience amongst other considerations, but considered to be competitive / attractive, together with medical and life insurances.

To apply, please use the form below

    [/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][vc_tta_accordion shape=”square” active_section=”666″ collapsible_all=”true” title=”Asia Pacific”][vc_tta_section title=”Principal Engineer – DP (Singapore)” tab_id=”principal-engineer-dp-singapore”][vc_column_text]

    Title: Principal Engineer – DP
    Reports to: Dynamic Positioning Manager
    Location: Singapore

    Job Overview

    The Principal Engineer will provide support to the Dynamic Positioning business lines in the region and globally, managing related projects using professional experience and basic principles.

    Key Responsibilities and Duties

    • Take part in technical and procedural reviews and marine study reports covering marine and offshore projects as well as site attendance
    • Contribute to the continual development of the Dynamic Positioning business lines
    • Conducting of Dynamic Positioning Technical Projects
    • Conducting of Dynamic Positioning Assurance Projects
    • Assist with preparation of tenders and proposals for Dynamic Positioning Services and other related offshore projects
    • Ensure all operations are conducted in full compliance with approved instructions, procedures and policies
    • Assist and/or lead projects (as assigned by the manager) to accomplish the overall delivery of optimum solutions to customers within the timeframe, costs and quality standards established by AqualisBraemar and/or the Client
    • Responsible for delivery of quality documents within a timeline established by management and client
    • Liaise with clients to ensure project completion and customer satisfaction
    • Other duties as assigned

    Specific Requirements

    • Primarily office-based but requirement for onsite (offshore) attendance and time with clients – Flexibility to working hours

    Qualifications

    Essential Desirable
    • Class 1 Chief Engineer Certificate of Competency or degree qualified or foreign equivalent in Marine Engineering
    • DP Technical/Maintenance certification from one of the major training institutes
    • Experienced seagoing Chief Engineer

    Work Experience

    Essential Desirable
    • Class 1 Chief Engineer of 10 years’ relevant professional experience with at least 4 years hands-on experience as Chief Engineer on DP Class 2 vessels
    • 3 years’ previous experience in a similar role
    • Demonstrate working knowledge of DP and associated Marine equipment
    • Previous experience gained from a similar role

    Technical Skills, Knowledge and Abilities

    Essential Desirable
    • Solid understanding of DP and Marine Engineering philosophies
    • Able to translate thoughts into well written documents
    • Technically and commercially astute
    • Ability to establish effective working relationship with clients
    • High level of competency in written English for the production of complex technical reports
    • Knowledge and understanding of industry guidance (IMCA/MTS

    Behavioural Skills, Personal Attributes and Competencies

    Essential Desirable
    • Strong people and interpersonal skills
    • Self-motivated, energetic and engaging
    • Ability to work well independently as well as part of a team
    • Excellent presentation skills

    To apply, please use the form below

    Please note that due to the large volume of applications, we will only respond to those selected for interview.

      [/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][/vc_row]

jetpack-related-posts.title: Tom Whittle | Taiwan Country Manager – OWC
Our Organisations
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar AqualisBraemar is a company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers adjusting, marine, offshore and renewables consultancy services to the energy, shipping and insurance industries. The group employs specialist engineers, naval architects, master mariners, loss adjusters and technical consultants in 48 offices located across 33 countries. Offshore Wind Consultants…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Marine & Offshore Engineering Services
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We provide marine & offshore engineering services in the major marine energy centers around the world. Our engineers have a good understanding of the local regulatory requirements, the available industry infrastructure and the culture they operate in.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Rassim Hariz | Head of Business Development – OWC
Jeff Fodiak | US Country Manager – OWC
About AqualisBraemar LOC Group
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Aqualis ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers energy consultancy services to the global oil and gas, wind and solar sectors.
